title: Looking for something similar to the Viacom logo
content:
Does anyone know the font used in Viacom's logo?

[http://www.viacom.com/Pages/default.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20130403113851/http:/www.viacom.com/Pages/default.aspx "http://www.viacom.com/Pages/default.aspx")

I suspect it might be a custom work, but would like to know if there is anything similar to it which could be used as a base.

Thanks alot
author: fsenterprises

comments.content:
Looks like its actually a real font, very similar, I would imagine they are from the same family, but can't find its name, any ideas ?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130403113851im_/http:/typophile.com/files/meed_4802.gif)

Not very similar, but it's got those rounded terminals sort of:

[http://www.dafont.com/patagonian-titles.font?nb\_ppp=50&text=VIACOM](http://web.archive.org/web/20130403113851/http:/www.dafont.com/patagonian-titles.font?nb_ppp=50&text=VIACOM "http://www.dafont.com/patagonian-titles.font?nb\_ppp=50&text=VIACOM")
Thanks for the link CreeDo, looks pretty similar on some characters.

I'm thinking this is a modified VAG.

- Lex

Sorry, I didn't read the first post. The Viacom logo is different from the picture you posted.

- Lex
Thanks Lex for the reply, for some reason the roundness of the font caught my eye, I can clearly see the difference between those two now, do you have any ideas what might 'MEED' be by any chance ?!

That's what I meant - MEED looks like a modified VAG.

- Lex
